meanings.definition: A barrier consisting of a horizontal bar and supports
meanings.sent1: The children held onto the railing as they climbed the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The balcony had a beautiful iron railing overlooking the garden.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to balance on the railing like a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed off the railing, filling the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The railing creaked under the weight of the leaning cat.

meanings.definition: A structure made of such a barrier, used as a guard or boundary
meanings.sent1: The old castle had stone railings surrounding the courtyard.
meanings.sent2: The park had wooden railings along the edge of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The dog peeked through the railing, trying to catch a glimpse of the squirrel.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a protective railing against the harsh criticism.
meanings.sent5: The railing marked the boundary between the two properties.

meanings.definition: To express objections or criticisms in a harsh or angry manner
meanings.sent1: She was railing against the unfair treatment of her friends.
meanings.sent2: The customer began railing at the poor service in the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The toddler started railing about having to eat vegetables for dinner.
meanings.sent4: His words were like sharp arrows, railing against the corrupt system.
meanings.sent5: The politician continued to rail against the opposing party during the debate.
